title: Paradox-Based Learning Course for Developing Transnational Leaders

context.prior_knowledge: Basic leadership theory and understanding of global business environments
context.additional_context: Strengthening the capacity to resolve paradoxical situations so that science field practitioners can demonstrate leadership in multicultural environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze five paradoxes in transnational leadership (self/others, individual/community, direct/indirect, action/existence, short-term/long-term) and derive contextually applicable solutions.
Through case-based activities in mobile microlearning environments, learners can establish collaborative strategies to resolve paradoxical conflict situations.
Via project-based assessments, learners can propose and implement practical work improvement plans that demonstrate transnational leadership competencies.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
